image.altText: Dolphin Sands bushfire emergency,

props.synopsis: Just days into summer, Tasmania is battling bushfires and their presence can be linked back to a rare spike in temperatures above Antarctica back in September.

title.children: Bushfires are already flaring in Tasmania and they may be a sign of what's to come.

image.altText: An orange bushfire burns behind a coastal town.

props.synopsis: As a bushfire rages on Tasmania's east coast, bayside resident Paul Worsteling shelters in his car, charging his phone while saltwater rains down on the roof.

title.children: Stieglitz residents stay to defend homes from bushfire

image.altText: Looking over the shoulder of a person watching a bushfire burning at St Helens.

props.synopsis: At least two properties have been destroyed in a bushfire burning near St Helens, on Tasmania's upper east coast.

title.children: Houses destroyed as firefighters battle bushfire near St Helens on Tasmania's east coast

image.altText: Unidentified Tasmania Fire Service worker with a bushfire in the background.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's bushfire season has suddenly arrived, with two catastrophes within days of each other. Here is how to prepare if one comes your way.

title.children: Tasmania's bushfire danger arrived suddenly. Here's how to prepare

image.altText: Kane Scott Dallow fraud charges.

props.synopsis: A convicted conman tells a court he was trying "to keep up an appearance" as he pleads guilty to forgery and fraud charges in a Tasmanian court.

title.children: Convicted conman Kane Dallow pleads guilty to forgery, fraud charges

image.altText: A man takes a smiling selfie with a basketball game and spectators behind him.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian government ministers have accessed more than $21,000 of free tickets to Tasmania JackJumpers games in the past 12 months, available as part of an agreement with the basketball club.

title.children: Tasmanian ministers access $45,000 in free NBL and AFL tickets

image.altText: A woman holds up a wooden toy.

props.synopsis: Loretta Olsen, 86, is saying goodbye to Salamanca Market after more than half a century of selling goods at the Hobart attraction.

title.children: Wooden-toy stallholder retires after 53 years at Salamanca Market

image.altText: The back of a young boy's head, looking toward a teacher at the front of a classroom.

props.synopsis: Most public schools in Burnie, Launceston and Hobart will close for half a day this Friday, as union members demand action on rising school violence and unfair wages.

title.children: Tasmanian public schools to close amid ongoing industrial action — here's what you should know

image.altText: A protester holds up an Aboriginal Lives Matter placard in Sydney's CBD.

props.synopsis: Australia recorded the largest number of Indigenous deaths in custody in the last financial year since 1979. Experts say over-incarceration remains a national crisis and prisons are neglecting the physical and mental health of vulnerable people.

title.children: 'It's maddening': Anger and frustration amid record Black deaths in custody

image.altText: A man in a green prison uniform sits looking into a webcam in a plain office room with white walls. He has a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: A landmark legal case against three of Australia's biggest online betting agencies has been filed in the Federal Court, aimed at recovering millions of dollars' worth of stolen money that was gambled away and kept by corporate bookmakers.

title.children: Landmark legal case could force betting agencies to return stolen millions

image.altText: A middle aged man stands in front of a fence with his arms around his wife

props.synopsis: Calls for politicians' family travel entitlements to be tightened are growing, as analysis shows one Nationals MP was allowed to charge taxpayers more than $80,000 flying his spouse to and from Canberra 27 times in two years.

title.children: Nationals MP's high family travel bill highlights generous rules

image.altText: Photo shows a logo for Netflix on a remote control

props.synopsis: Australians' electricity bills have become a nightmare of complexity and high prices. An energy regulator says subscription fees could be an answer.

title.children: Netflix-like power charges on the cards as energy rule-maker flags major reset

image.altText: Donald Trump looks on aboard Air Force One

props.synopsis: Applicants would also have to submit phone numbers, email addresses, personal details of family members and biometric information under the plan.

title.children: Trump plans to make Australians hand over social media data to enter US

image.altText: Illustration of hands using flint and pyrite to produce sparks.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists have uncovered the earliest-known evidence of deliberately lit campfires at a site in the UK dated to be 400,000 years old.

title.children: Neanderthals may have been fire starters 400,000 years ago

image.altText: Stacey Warnecke smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coroner's court has heard Melbourne nutrition influencer Stacey Warnecke died from a postpartum haemorrhage following a freebirth in September.

title.children: Melbourne influencer died from haemorrhage after freebirth, court hears

image.altText: A middle-aged man with dark hair stares intently while sitting in a gilded room.

props.synopsis: In a leaked internal cable, Secretary of State Marco Rubio calls the department's decision to adopt Calibri in 2023 a "wasteful" diversity move.

title.children: US State Department to revert to Times New Roman font over 'wasteful' Calibri

image.altText: Two girls in school uniforms look at a phone.

props.synopsis: It's day one of the social media ban, but dozens of parents have told the ABC their children have already been able to get around the restrictions.

title.children: Age verification errors, beauty tricks see under-16s still having social media access

image.altText: caravans in a row

props.synopsis: Zone RV plunged into administration last week, leaving customers, suppliers, employees and taxpayers in a $40 million hole.

title.children: Collapsed caravan manufacturer's staggering debt revealed

image.altText: A screenshot from bodycam footage of Luigi Mangione sitting at a McDonald's table, talking to a police officer.

props.synopsis: A to-do list and travel plans shed light on the steps the 27-year-old may have taken — or planned to take — to avoid capture after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's killing last year.

title.children: Luigi Mangione's to-do list, travel plans found during his arrest

image.altText: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado holds her hand on her heart during a protest.

props.synopsis: Democracies must be prepared to fight for freedom in order to survive, Nobel Peace Prize laureate and Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado says in a speech delivered by her daughter.

title.children: Democracies must fight for freedom, Nobel Peace Prize laureate Machado says

image.altText: Author Sophie Kinsella poses

props.synopsis: Kinsella, who also published under her real name, Madeleine Wickham, announced in April 2024 that she had been diagnosed in late 2022 with glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer.

title.children: Sophie Kinsella, author of the best-selling Shopaholic novels, dies at 55

image.altText: Dozens of bikes, tractors and makeshift rickshaws form a long line on a road with people and goods inside them

props.synopsis: Thailand has rejected Donald Trump's plan to call both sides to achieve peace, with half a million people forced to flee the fighting along the border.

title.children: Trump's plan to call Thailand and Cambodia to achieve peace rejected

image.altText: A person is holding a sperm sample tube

props.synopsis: Between 2006 and 2022, the man's sperm was sold to 67 clinics in 14 countries, whereas 99 children were fathered by the donor in Denmark alone.

title.children: Nearly 200 children conceived from sperm donor with increased cancer risk

image.altText: four men in suits stare into the camera

props.synopsis: It has been almost 50 years since armed men burst into the Lufthansa cargo terminal at New York's John F Kennedy International Airport and got away with stealing millions.

title.children: How a van full of armed men and millions of dollars inspired Goodfellas

image.altText: Australia men's Test cricket captain Pat Cummins wearing a hat and jacket, walking on the field

props.synopsis: Australia's captain is poised to make his return to the Ashes as Australia names its squad ahead of the third Test at the Adelaide Oval.

title.children: Cummins's return made official as Aussies name squad for Adelaide

image.altText: The exterior of Bed Bath N' Table, which has beds and other homewares inside. It's within a mall.

props.synopsis: The stoush began in 2021 when the company House began opening new stores selling soft furnishings under the name House, Bed & Bath.

title.children: Retailer Bed Bath N' Table wins High Court case against competitor

image.altText: A large grey ship sails on open waters against a grey sky

props.synopsis: China and Japan have given differing accounts of the incident, which was a major escalation in tensions between the two nations.

title.children: 'Stronger than ever': US backs Japan in dispute with China over radar incident

image.altText: Rescue workers and residents search for survivors amid the wreckage of two collapsed buildings

props.synopsis: The two adjacent four-storey buildings that collapsed overnight were home to eight families, the country's state news agency says.

title.children: At least 22 killed in building collapse in Morocco's Fez city

image.altText: A green prawn in someone's gloved hand with white spots on its skin.

props.synopsis: White spot disease in prawns has led the NSW government to issue a new, five-year control order which will ban the sale of green prawns caught in affected waters.

title.children: Ban on sale of northern NSW green prawns a 'death knell' for industry

image.altText: Cars on a road leading into Sydney, with toll signs above saying city north, city and western suburbs.

props.synopsis: Drivers are set to be tolled on all three Sydney Harbour crossings in 2028, but a weekly toll cap will be made permanent, the NSW government confirms.

title.children: Toll cap made permanent, two-way tolling confirmed for Sydney Harbour

image.altText: a pot of honey in a bush setting.

props.synopsis: Australian beekeepers are funding their own investigation into the authenticity of imported honey, with tests showing other products are being added.

title.children: What's really in your jar of supermarket honey?

image.altText: A person standing next to a balloon in a field in the dark.

props.synopsis: The balloons have been causing disruptions with air traffic since October. Here's what we know.

title.children: What we know about the smuggling balloons disrupting air traffic in Lithuania

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman in a mortarboard hat and graduate's gown stands in front of a UQ backdrop.

props.synopsis: According to her father, Kirsten Moriarty had lodged a stalking report prior to her body being found in a car outside a NSW police station.

title.children: Woman found dead in police car park 'believed she was being stalked'

image.altText: A picture of two septic tanks with lids off in a remote community backyard.

props.synopsis: Aboriginal housing advocates are calling for urgent improvements to the way remote public housing is maintained in the Northern Territory, after the coroner found the death of a toddler who fell into a backyard septic tank could have been prevented.

title.children: Calls for government action after toddler's death inside unsafe septic tank

image.altText: Police tape cordons off a crime scene.

props.synopsis: Detectives have discovered what appear to be human remains while investigating the disappearance of a Melbourne toddler 11 years ago.

title.children: Remains found during investigation into toddler's disappearance
